E0D9258E82DA4D54A2E7D9BC05B50810.description:
Use mathematical representations to support explanations of how natural selection may lead to increases and
decreases of specific traits in populations over time.

060D49FDAFC8463781466055BB29F31C.description:
Gather and synthesize information about technologies that have changed the way humans influence the
inheritance of desired traits in organisms.

6F219B78EC5D48B3B1793072C9BFBC02.description:
Construct an explanation based on evidence that describes how genetic variations of traits in a population
increase some individuals’ probability of surviving and reproducing in a specific environment.

F064ED3B8E694448BCFA7AB7D9A9AEB6.description:
Analyze displays of pictorial data to compare patterns of similarities in the embryological development across
multiple species to identify relationships not evident in the fully formed anatomy.

51883CFD4949468B91B586EBF86DD53F.description:
Apply scientific ideas to construct an explanation for the anatomical similarities and differences among modern
organisms and between modern and fossil organisms to infer evolutionary relationships.

18127727CA084E49B20F46DBB877478C.description:
Analyze and interpret data for patterns in the fossil record that document the existence, diversity, extinction,
and change of life forms throughout the history of life on Earth under the assumption that natural laws operate
today as in the past.

A4D7C533588D45CCB07716976CAE79CC.description:
Develop and use a model to describe why asexual reproduction results in offspring with identical genetic
information and sexual reproduction results in offspring with genetic variation.

1CE52DA36D294DB6B3A65434C8FB3226.description:
Develop and use a model to describe why structural changes to genes (mutations) located on chromosomes may
affect proteins and may result in harmful, beneficial, or neutral effects to the structure and function of the
organism.

67B3D751B61946D19324E2EA50E13507.description: Heredity: Inheritance and Variation of Traits

72C16721C4964F6E937033BF3FF2A550.description: Evaluate competing design solutions for maintaining biodiversity and ecosystem services.*

4329BC9A16834F368F637C978A410244.description:
Construct an argument supported by empirical evidence that changes to physical or biological components of an
ecosystem affect populations.

E68C6FE74CA74146A74A30A13B2B99C4.description:
Develop a model to describe the cycling of matter and flow of energy among living and nonliving parts of an
ecosystem.

C3E4FD8EC85B4263BA20A2A3FF1A2897.description: Construct an explanation that predicts patterns of interactions among organisms across multiple ecosystems.

3E9C165D01634971BC206A7C2E7A29B7.description:
Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence for the effects of resource availability on organisms and
populations of organisms in an ecosystem.

BCE4812BC4C24F9E9B1AD67D67566CD2.description:
Gather and synthesize information that sensory receptors respond to stimuli by sending messages to the brain
for immediate behavior or storage as memories.

F6F1F72B213B4765B48AEF3865C99ECE.description:
Develop a model to describe how food is rearranged through chemical reactions forming new molecules that
support growth and/or release energy as this matter moves through an organism.

880A4A3C7090434D9D64710A9799365F.description:
Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for the role of photosynthesis in the cycling of matter and
flow of energy into and out of organisms.

639611939E6D4FF2BAE4043CADA99731.description:
Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how environmental and genetic factors influence the
growth of organisms.

2663693554714A1BAFF262F6DE171291.description:
Use argument based on empirical evidence and scientific reasoning to support an explanation for how
characteristic animal behaviors and specialized plant structures affect the probability of successful reproduction
of animals and plants respectively

8A765ED7E29049069F20006BEA05EAA3.description:
Use argument supported by evidence for how the body is a system of interacting subsystems composed of
groups of cells.

8342DF4F9F474E5DA86509EA572C5214.description:
Develop and use a model to describe the function of a cell as a whole and ways the parts of cells contribute to the
function.

033D2A44D7A84B96BA33DB4F438DF653.description:
Conduct an investigation to provide evidence that living things are made of cells; either one cell or many
different numbers and types of cells.

AF1F08F15F7E4D25B27C388D6631BDD2.description: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes
